name: The Circus Hotel

reviews.title: Great service - good property
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 days in late July. Service at the front desk was great! Gerry and a couple of other young ladies at the front desk were excellent answering questions, helping us navigate the area, recommending restaurants. We were surprised that the property didn't have air conditioning, but were lucky that the room had a fan, because the several days we were there it was hot outside. Our room faced the street, which constantly has cars and trams going through. So, we had to keep the windows closed during the night. There are 2 laundry facilities across the street in case you have an extended trip. Cost about $25 to do 2 loads and dry our clothes. The room itself wasn't very big, but had a nice sized bathroom. There was very little room between the bed and the wall as a walkway. The metal corners of the bed were sharp, and both my wife and I came home with scratches on the calves of our legs from walking around the bed. The restaurant attached to the hotel had poor service and poor food. The TV in the room had only 1 or 2 English speaking channels. Cleaning staff did a nice job for us each morning. On the last day of our stay we went upstairs to the rooftop and enjoyed a beer and glass of wine. It was a nice ending to our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel. Stayed three nights. Loved the location - right near the underground station but also an easy walk to anywhere. Lots of bars and restaurants within 1 km. Room was clean and bed was very good. Only drawback to the hotel is the noise from the street - the windows are soundproof when closed but with no air-con it can get pretty hot. Ask for a room that does not face the street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Circus Hotel was everything Tripadvisor promised and more. We arrived in the middle of a heat wave, very jet lagged, and were wowed at how easy it was to get to the hotel from the airport. The front desk was extremely welcoming and apologetic regarding the heat, but really it was among the most comfortable rooms during our entire German stay! We had a basic double bed room and it was exactly the size we needed. Extremely comfy bed and very spacious bathroom with excellent shower and toiletry items. The hotel is decorated in a cute trendy manner without being obnoxious. A real highlight of the hotel is its location. You are directly above a major transit stop and within walking distance to so many of Berlin's most delicious restaurants and fun bars. We did not want to leave after our 3 day stay there, if you are headed to Berlin DO NOT MISS THE CIRCUS!!!!
reviews.title: Booked online - so glad we chose to stay here

reviews.text: We stayed in room 309 from SAT-2013-08-10 to SUN-2013-08-11 and got a mixed impression of the Circus Hotel. The room faces Rosenthaler Str. and the windows, despite clearly being of very high quality, did not really manage to keep out the noise, so we were woken up early by the sound of the tram. The noise problem was compounded by the fact that the hotel is not air-conditioned. There was a fan, but the room was nevertheless somewhat stuffy. Given the noise, opening the windows was not an option. If and when it gets hot (which does occasionally happen even in Germany :-)) it would get rather uncomfortable in that room. Also, if I had been traveling on business the small work desk would not have been sufficient to work on comfortably. On the plus side, we found the hotel staff to be really, really friendly and knowledgeable. We got an excellent, spot-on restaurant recommendation and the people we encountered clearly wanted to help and knew their way around the city. The location on Rosenthaler Platz is wonderful when traveling for leisure; the neighborhood is extremely pleasant to walk around in and the Circus has its own lovely roof-top terrace bar (of sorts; it's self-service drinks from a fridge but fantastic views and a really nice atmosphere). Lack of AC and the noise aside, the room was very nicely designed and the bed was comfortable, too. All in all, my bottom line on the Circus Hotel is: 1. I would not stay there when traveling on business. There are too many better options in Berlin. 2. If you stay there make sure you get a room facing the inner courtyard.
reviews.title: Spacious Apartment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Circus Hotel is located in a great location. There is a U-Bahn Station 10 meters away, and an S-Bahn Station a 10-minute walk away. There is some of the best shopping in the city in the area all around the hotel. We walked to a number of attractions, and took the trains to the rest. There are a number of fantastic restaurants in the area (and reasonably priced). The hotel is attached to a restaurant, which offers a good breakfast buffet that we made use of every day.
reviews.title: Awesome location, and great value

reviews.text: The hotel itself was really nice, and decorated very brightly; the rooms were top-notch. Our room was quite spacious.

reviews.text: The staff were very nice, and were super helpful. They had suggestions for things to see, and ideas on different things to do. When it rained they offered us an umbrella as long as we promised to bring it back! They had a number of activities in the hotel like yoga and a drinks on the roof patio with the owners (did I mention there's a roof patio?).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: One downside is that while it is in a good location, it is located at a busy intersection (two large streets), so there is a bit of noise. If it's not too hot and you can close the windows, you won't hear it at night, but if the windows are open, it is something you'll be thinking about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for our 4 day stay. Ideally located for subway from airport and quick and easy transfers all over town, ESP Kreuzberg. It's in North Mitte and walkable all over the centre and in to Prenzlauer Berg. The staff were very friendly and the hotel is spotless, quiet and comfortable. Highly recommended and would stay again. My 4th trip to Berlin and this is the best place I've stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made reservation at this hotel based on the reviews at Tripadvisor. And it was not disappointing at all. The hotel is located at the junction with perfect location - next door to the subway station, across the tram stop and bus stop; and surrounded with many restaurants, cafes, and shops. The service was impecable as the staff seem to really enjoy making sure you get what you want and need. They speak very good English as well. The room is rather small but newly renovated and very clean. The rate is affordable. So 5 stars from me !

description: Dear Circus Guest,We are looking forward to welcome you to the Circus Hotel, bringing to you 60 single and double rooms, junior suites and apartments with all facilities.Opened October 30th, 2008, the Circus Hotel continues our tradition of a friendly welcome to Berlin, and has been designed to reflect our commitments to hospitality, individuality and sustainability. At the Circus Hotel you will not only find comfortable accommodation, but also a range of services to make your stay truly special, including iPods’ loaded with the best of Berlin music, bike and segway rental, and a garden courtyard that provides the perfect place to relax, unwind, and reflect on your Berlin experiences. Of course we provide free Wi-Fi troughout the building.Added to this, at our restaurant Fabisch you can discover a modern and healthy approach to German cooking, sip cocktails in the manner of Sally Bowles, and enjoy a range of artistic and cultural events that reflect the nature of our city.
